metadata.title: CVE-2021-35564 on Ubuntu 16.04 LTS (xenial) - medium
metadata.description:
Vulnerability in the Java SE, Oracle GraalVM Enterprise Edition product ofOracle Java SE (component: Keytool). Supported versions that are affectedare Java SE: 7u311, 8u301, 11.0.12, 17; Oracle GraalVM Enterprise Edition:20.3.3 and 21.2.0. Easily exploitable vulnerability allows unauthenticatedattacker with network access via multiple protocols to compromise Java SE,Oracle GraalVM Enterprise Edition. Successful attacks of this vulnerabilitycan result in unauthorized update, insert or delete access to some of JavaSE, Oracle GraalVM Enterprise Edition accessible data. Note: Thisvulnerability applies to Java deployments, typically in clients runningsandboxed Java Web Start applications or sandboxed Java applets, that loadand run untrusted code (e.g., code that comes from the internet) and relyon the Java sandbox for security. This vulnerability can also be exploitedby using APIs in the specified Component, e.g., through a web service whichsupplies data to the APIs. CVSS 3.1 Base Score 5.3 (Integrity impacts).CVSS Vector: (CVSS:3.1/AV:N/AC:L/PR:N/UI:N/S:U/C:N/I:L/A:N).

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2021-35564` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

openjdk-8-demo - 8u312-b07-0ubuntu1~16.04
openjdk-8-jdk - 8u312-b07-0ubuntu1~16.04
openjdk-8-jdk-headless - 8u312-b07-0ubuntu1~16.04
openjdk-8-jre - 8u312-b07-0ubuntu1~16.04
openjdk-8-jre-headless - 8u312-b07-0ubuntu1~16.04
openjdk-8-jre-jamvm - 8u312-b07-0ubuntu1~16.04
openjdk-8-jre-zero - 8u312-b07-0ubuntu1~16.04
openjdk-8-source - 8u312-b07-0ubuntu1~16.04
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

criterions.comment: openjdk-8 package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '8u312-b07-0ubuntu1~16.04').
openjdk-9: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'no longer supported by upstream').
